Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Henry J. Meyer United States National War Labor Board Files
United States. National War Labor Board (1942-1945)
Meyer, Henry J.
Meyer, Henry J.
TAM.085
1.25 Linear Feet in 3 manuscript boxes
1941-1947 The material comes from the National War Labor Board (NWLB) files of Henry J. Meyer and consists of correspondence between Meyer and labor unions (both established and independent unions), national and regional boards of the (NWLB), the Dade County (Florida) Stabilization Panel, and the National Telephone panel. Materials are in English
Historical/Biographical Note
Henry J. Meyer was the United States National War Labor Board (NWLB) liaison officer for independent unions. During World War II he was vice-chairman of the NWLB's National Telephone Panel and chair of the Wage Stabilization Board.
Scope and Contents
The material comes from the National War Labor Board (NWLB) files of Henry J. Meyer and consists of correspondence between Meyer and labor unions (both established and independent unions), national and regional boards of the (NWLB), the Dade County (Florida) Stabilization Panel, and the National Telephone panel.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Henry J. Meyer United States National War Labor Board Files; TAM 085; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1941-1947, are expected to enter the public domain in 2068.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1978.016.
